alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 1:37PM CDT until May 12 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Smith County in north central Kansas... Phillips County in north central Kansas... Western Franklin County in south central Nebraska... Southern Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Southwestern Kearney County in south central Nebraska... Southeastern Furnas County in south central Nebraska... Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 136 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stamford to near Long Island to near Speed, moving northeast at 50 mph. This warning is replacing the previous warning for Phillips County. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Stamford and Woodruff around 140 PM CDT. Oxford and Orleans around 145 PM CDT. Alma around 150 PM CDT. Harlan County Dam around 155 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Republican City, Atlanta, Huntley, Ragan, Hildreth, Wilcox, Naponee and Bloomington. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
